name: Music Composer
overview: Music Composer Cartridge for Commodore Max Machine (also works on the Commodore 64). The MAX Machine was a game machine developed prior to the Commodore 64 and sold only in Japan. Commodore made about 25 game cartridges for the MAX machine, but since the system was largely a flop, few were produced and the games are hard to find. Because the Commodore 64 was designed with a MAX emulation mode, all MAX cartridges also work on the Commodore 64. As sales were poor many were slightly repackaged and later sold on the Commodore 64 market.
